slides.title: What is a Container?
slides.text: A container is a standard unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another.

slides.title: What is a Container?
slides.text: It [...] is a lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings.

slides.title: What is a Container?
slides.text: It is a disposable unit. Once it's completed, it destroys itself along with all other dependencies.
